intro: Cyrtandra wichmanniana, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant is often found growing in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
